title: Hadley railway station
text:
Hadley railway station was a <a href="railway%20station">railway station</a> serving the village of <a href="Hadley%2C%20Shropshire">Hadley</a> in <a href="Shropshire">Shropshire</a>, England. The station served both the former <a href="Stafford%20to%20Shrewsbury%20Line">Stafford to Shrewsbury Line</a> and was the start of the <a href="Coalport%20Branch%20Line">branch</a> to Coalport. The station was opened in 1849 and closed in 1964.
The line through Hadley was closed from 1964, with the last remaining stretches of track being taken up in 1991. In the late 2000s a stretch of track was relaid to the <a href="Telford%20International%20Railfreight%20Park">Telford International Railfreight Park</a> for freight purposes only.
The current closest station is <a href="Wellington%20%28Shropshire%29">Wellington</a>, or a little further afield are both <a href="Oakengates%20railway%20station">Oakengates</a> or <a href="Telford%20Central%20railway%20station">Telford</a>.
